info.title: Benefits Claims
info.description:
## Background

The Benefits Claims API Version 2 lets internal consumers: 

-   Retrieve existing claim information, including status, by claim ID
-   Automatically establish an Intent To File (21-0966) in VBMS

Additional functionality will be added over time.

You should use the [Benefits Claims API Version 1](https://developer.va.gov/explore/benefits/docs/claims?version=current) if: 

-   You are not an internal consumer, and/or
-   You want automatic establishment of disability compensation claims in Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) or power of attorney (POA)
    
## Technical Overview

This API accepts a payload of requests and responses with the payload identifying the claim and Veteran. Responses provide the submission’s processing status. Responses also provide a unique ID which can be used with the appropriate GET endpoint to return detailed, end-to-end claims status tracking. 

End-to-end claims tracking provides the status of claims as they move through the submission process, but does not return whether the claim was approved or denied. 

### Claim statuses

-   Pending - the claim is successfully submitted to Lighthouse
-   Errored -  the submission encountered upstream errors
-   Canceled -  the claim was identified as a duplicate or another issue caused the claim to be canceled. For duplicate claims,  the tracking of the claim's progress happens under a different Claim ID . 

Other statuses this API returns align with the [VA.gov](http://va.gov/) [claim status descriptions](https://www.va.gov/resources/what-your-claim-status-means/), which are:

-   Claim received
-   Initial review
-   Evidence gathering, review, and decision
-   Preparation for notification
-   Complete

### Finding a Veteran's unique VA ID

This API uses a unique Veteran identifier to identify the subject of each API request. This Veteran identifier can be retrieved by passing the Veteran’s first name, last name, DOB, and SSN to the ‘/veteran-id’ endpoint. This identifier should then be used as the Veteran ID parameter in request URLs.

Note: though Veteran identifiers are typically static, they may change over time. If a specific Veteran ID suddenly responds with a ‘404 not found’ error, the identifier may have changed. It’s a good idea to periodically check the identifier for each Veteran.

### Authentication and authorization

To make an API request, use our [client credentials grant](https://developer.va.gov/explore/authorization/docs/client-credentials?api=claims) to receive an [OAuth token](https://oauth.net/2/). 

### Test data for sandbox environment use

We use mock [test data in the sandbox environment](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-api-clients/blob/master/test_accounts.md). Sandbox test data and test users for the Benefits Claims API are valid for all versions of the API.

tags.name: Veteran Identifier
tags.description: Allows authenticated veterans and veteran representatives to retrieve a veteran's id.

tags.name: Claims
tags.description: Allows authenticated and authorized users to access claims data for a given Veteran. No data is returned if the user is not authenticated and authorized.

tags.name: 5103 Waiver
tags.description: Allows authenticated and authorized users to file a 5103 Notice Response on a claim.

tags.name: Intent to File
tags.description: Allows authenticated and authorized users to automatically establish an Intent to File (21-0966) in VBMS.

productionOauth.description: This API uses OAuth 2 with the authorization code grant flow. [More info](https://developer.va.gov/explore/authorization?api=claims)

sandboxOauth.description: This API uses OAuth 2 with the authorization code grant flow. [More info](https://developer.va.gov/explore/authorization?api=claims)

post.description: Allows authenticated and authorized users to retrieve a Veteran's ID.

errors.title: invalid value for SSN
errors.detail: blank is not valid for SSN

firstName.description: First name of Veteran being represented

lastName.description: Last name of Veteran being represented

birthdate.description: Date of birth of Veteran being represented, in iso8601 format

get.summary: Find all benefits claims for a Veteran.

id.description: Claim ID in VBMS. If a claim was submitted with Lighthouse and not successfully established upstream, it could have a null claimId.

claimDate.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD the claim was first filed

phaseChangeDate.description: The date that the claim changed to its current phase

developmentLetterSent.description: If true, a development letter has been sent to the claimant regarding a benefit claim

decisionLetterSent.description: If true, a decision letter has been sent to the claimant regarding a benefit claim

documentsNeeded.description: If true, the claim requires additional documents to be submitted

evidenceWaiverSubmitted5103.description: If true, indicates a decision has been requested and/or a Waiver 5103 has been submitted

get.description: Retrieves a specific claim for a Veteran

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the claim being requested

trackedItems.displayName: Line of Duty determination from claimant

data.description: Claim with some details for the given Veteran info

id.description: Claim ID in VBMS. If a claim was submitted with Lighthouse and not successfully established upstream, it could have a null claimId.

contentions.description: The contentions being submitted with a claim

claimDate.description: The date a claim was filed

currentPhaseBack.description: Indicates whether the current phase is moving backward.

latestPhaseType.description: The most current phase for the claim

phaseChangeDate.description: The date that the claim changed to its current phase

phase1CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the claim received phase.

phase2CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the initial review phase.

phase3CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the gathering of evidence phase.

phase4CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the reviewing of evidence phase.

phase5CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the preparation for decision phase.

phase6CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the pending decision approval phase.

phase7CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the preparation for notification phase.

phase8CompleteDate.description: Completed date of the completed phase.

decisionLetterSent.description: If true, a decision letter has been sent to the claimant regarding a benefit claim

developmentLetterSent.description: If true, a development letter has been sent to the claimant regarding a benefit claim

documentsNeeded.description: If true, the claim requires additional documents to be submitted

evidenceWaiverSubmitted5103.description: If true, indicates a decision has been requested and/or a Waiver 5103 has been submitted

errors.description: Error details if claim is in an errored state.

submitterApplicationCode.description: Application Code of benefit claim submitter

submitterRoleCode.description: Role Code of benefit claim submitter

supportingDocuments.description: Information regarding any supported documents attached to a claim

uploadDate.description: Date and time document was uploaded

closedDate.description: Date the tracked item was closed

requestedDate.description: Date the tracked item was requested

receivedDate.description: Date the tracked item was received

overdue.description: True if the item is overdue

status.description: Enum with the status of the tracked item

post.description: Establishes a Disability Compensation Claim in VBMS.

Test to make sure the form submission works with your parameters.
Submission validates against the schema returned by the GET /forms/526 endpoint.

Used to attach supporting documents for a 526 claim. For wet-signature PDFs, use the PUT /forms/526/{id} endpoint.

This endpoint accepts a document binary PDF as part of a multi-part payload (for example, attachment1, attachment2, attachment3).

attachment1.description: Attachment contents. Must be provided in binary PDF or [base64 string](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-api/master/modules/claims_api/spec/fixtures/base64pdf) format and less than 11 in x 11 in.

attachment2.description: Attachment contents. Must be provided in binary PDF or [base64 string](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-api/master/modules/claims_api/spec/fixtures/base64pdf) format and less than 11 in x 11 in.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the claim being requested

get.summary: Returns last active Intent to File form submission for given 'type'.
get.description: Returns Veteran's last active Intent to File submission for given benefit type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of Intent to File to return. Available values - compensation, pension, survivor.

200.description: Successful response with active Intent to File

creationDate.description: Date the Intent to File was received at the VA

expirationDate.description: Date the Intent to File expires, this is 1 year from the createdDate

status.description: The status of the Intent to File

type.description: The type of Intent to File filed.

errors.title: Resource not found
errors.detail: No active 'compensation' intent to file found.

post.description: Establishes an Intent to File for disability compensation, pension, and survivor claims.

creationDate.description: Date the Intent to File was received at the VA

expirationDate.description: Date the Intent to File expires, this is 1 year from the createdDate

status.description: The status of the Intent to File

type.description: The type of Intent to File filed.

errors.title: invalid value for type
errors.detail: some-invalid-value is not valid for type

errors.title: Unprocessable Entity
errors.detail: Claimant SSN cannot be the same as veteran SSN for type 'survivor'

type.description: Type of Intent To File being submitted. For type "survivor", the request must include claimantSsn and be made by a valid Veteran Representative. If the Representative is not a Veteran or a VA employee, this method is currently not available to them, and they should use the Benefits Intake API as an alternative.

post.description: Validates an Intent to File for disability compensation, pension, and survivor claims.

status.description: The status of the Intent to File

errors.title: invalid value for type
errors.detail: some-invalid-value is not valid for type

type.description: Type of Intent To File being submitted. For type "survivor", the request must include claimantSsn and be made by a valid Veteran Representative. If the Representative is not a Veteran or a VA employee, this method is currently not available to them, and they should use the Benefits Intake API as an alternative.
